it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket

Class RawIpSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket.Socket
      • it.unipr.netsec.rawsocket.RawIpSocket

  • public class RawIpSocket
extends Socket
    RawIpSocket implements an IP socket interface for sending and receiving IP packets as raw byte arrays.

    When receiving an IPv4 packet, the entire packet (including the IP header) is obtained. When receiving an IPv6 packet, only the packet payload is obtained.

    When sending an IPv4 packet, if the parameter 'raw' has been set to true the IPv4 header must also be included within the byte array passed to the send method. Conversely, if the parameter 'raw' has been set to false, the IP header is automatically added and must not be included within the byte array passed to the send method. In this case only the packet payload must be provided.

    A RawIpSocket is associated to a protocol number (i.e. the 'IP_PROTO' header field).

    If the raw parameter is false (non raw mode), the behavior of the socket is identical to Ip4Socket or Ip6Socket (depending on the version parameter). For IPv6 see also the note below.

    IMPORTANT: The 'raw' mode can only be used with IP version 4. Unfortunately standard API for IP version 6 does not provide a raw interface. For sending/receiving IPv6 raw packets you probably should use a level 2 socket (e.g. 'PF_PACKET' socket domain).

    • Constructor Detail

      • RawIpSocket

        public RawIpSocket(int version,
                   int proto,
                   boolean raw)
        Creates a new socket.
        Parameters:
        version - IP version (4 or 6)
        proto - the protocol number to bind the socket to
        raw - if true, the IP header must be included within the byte array passed to the send method; conversely, if false, the header is automatically added
